sn35.129:1.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
sn35.129:1.2: Then the householder Ghosita went up to Venerable Ānanda, and said to him:
sn35.129:1.3: “Sir, Ānanda, they speak of ‘the diversity of elements’.
sn35.129:1.4: In what way did the Buddha speak of the diversity of elements?”
sn35.129:1.5: “Householder, the eye element is found, as are agreeable sights, and eye consciousness.
sn35.129:1.6: Pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn35.129:1.7: The eye element is found, as are disagreeable sights, and eye consciousness.
sn35.129:1.8: Painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn35.129:1.9: The eye element is found, as are sights that are a basis for equanimity, and eye consciousness.
sn35.129:1.10: Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.
sn35.129:1.17: mind element is found, as are agreeable thoughts, and mind consciousness.
sn35.129:1.18: Pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
sn35.129:1.19: The mind element is found, as are disagreeable thoughts, and mind consciousness.
sn35.129:1.20: Painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
sn35.129:1.21: The mind element is found, as are thoughts that are a basis for equanimity, and mind consciousness.
sn35.129:1.22: Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.
sn35.129:1.23: This is how the Buddha spoke of the diversity of elements.”
